learning_outcomes.description: Critically evaluate existing literature in a chosen field interpreting research findings accurately, drawing appropriate conclusions, identifying gaps, inconsistencies and limitations to provide a nuanced understanding of the current state of knowledge.

Critically evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of different arguments and theories, analyse the methodological approaches used in studies, and assess the implications of the literature to inform current practice and recommend future research.

Using an integrated understanding of research, design and develop an integrative review which synthesizes information from diverse sources to construct a comprehensive and cohesive narrative that reflects the current knowledge, debates, theories, and frameworks in the research area.

Demonstrate advanced communication skills to articulate complex ideas clearly, structure arguments logically, and use appropriate academic conventions and referencing styles to effectively present research findings.

assessments.task_description:
The Foundation Assessment requires you to reflect on your area of interest or practice and develop a research question informed through engaging with current literature. You are required to provide a short context around why this question is pertinent to your area of interest or practice, present an answerable research question, and identify and justify the framework for how you plan to access literature specific to your research question. You are also required to outline any potential issues which might exist given the literature specific to your topic.

Full details for the Foundation assessment can be found on the course BlackBoard Ultra site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission will be through the course Blackboard site using the Turnitin link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Part A: pre-submission 8/09/2025 1:00 pm

Part A: viva voce (across weeks 7 and 8) 9/09/2025 7:00 am

Part B: integrative review 31/10/2025 1:00 pm

Viva voce will be conducted across weeks 7 and 8 of semester.
assessments.task_description:
Building on your first assessment, the second HLTH7316 assessment requires you to present mapping of your proposed integrative review (part A) and then, incorporating the feedback received on your mapping, present results of your integrative review with an accompanying short discussion.

The full details of the 'Mapping and Integrative Review' assessment can be found on your course BlackBoard Ultra site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of Assessment 2 will be through the course Blackboard site using the Turnitin link (for both Part A pre-submission and Part B integrative review).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 12(28 Jul - 26 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Course lectures

Online lectures delivered as part of this course are designed to support your learning and will assist you in understanding the content which will assist you to meet the course learning outcomes. It is recommended students attend the course lectures. The lectures can also be accessed at a future point in time as all lectures are recorded.
